author: alexssd7fp
content:
Last thing I will do here, is I will share the Python script used to calculate the ETH's PoW usage. (finally found it)
```py
from si_prefix import si_format

# Source: https://www.statista.com/statistics/280704/world-power-consumption
world_consumption_twatts = 23845  # IMPORTANT: Terrawats per HOUR, not per YEAR
world_consumption_watts = 23845 * 1000000000000

# Source: https://etherscan.io/chart/hashrate
hashrate_ghs = 987800.81

asic_share = 0.4

# Source: various sources (https://hashrate.no/ for GPUs and manufacturer's websites for ASICs)
gpu_watt_per_mh = 2.3
asic_watt_per_mh = 1.7

avg_watt_per_mh = (asic_watt_per_mh * asic_share) + \
    (gpu_watt_per_mh * (1 - asic_share))

print("avg watt per mh", avg_watt_per_mh)

consumption = hashrate_ghs * 1000 * avg_watt_per_mh

print("consumption", si_format(consumption) + "W", "or", consumption, "W")
print(
    f"consumption share of the world: {'{:f}'.format(consumption/world_consumption_watts*100)}%")
```
Output:
```
avg watt per mh 2.06
consumption 2.0 GW or 2034869668.6000001 W
consumption share of the world: 0.000009%
```

Final result: **consumption share of the world: 0.000009%**
*Additionally: Assuming that we have 7,936,225,630 people on our planet, 2.0 GW is 2034869668/7936225630=0.2564026985709578 W per person (including industrial facilities together - they consume the most).* For comparison, a regular small heater consumes 5850x as much (1.5 kW).
